intro: Isochoriste africana, commonly known as African isochoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along streams. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
